comment: Great professor. willing to do meetings to help u understand where ur writing can improve. Quizzes are easy as long as u read the material. The main focus is ur writing projects. a non-fiction short story, a fiction story & 2 poems. If u like creative writing, you will LOVE this class. The final is a portfolio of all ur work and an analysis paper.

I loved Dr.Smith. Her class was simple we had about 3 quizzez and each quiz prepped us for the paper that we would write. Overall this class is easy if you do your work on time and attendance is mandatory but not strictly enforced. It was hybrid though so she valued our inperson days
She is super sweet 3 essays and an end of the year presentation super easy and straightforward TAKE HER
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: She provides the text for you, her class is really easy as long as you read the rubric and follow her instructions. She's also easy to reach and is open to meeting when you need help. Also please read the syllabus and you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: not a lot of work overall and Shes a fairly easy grader. she tries to make assignments as simple as possible for you if you show up to class and participate.
She is very nice and gives great feedback! I 100% recommend her, she grades nicely and she makes the class fun!
The essays and the end of year presentation weigh heavily on your grade.

I personally am not a research person, so Prof Smith's class helped me a lot. One project throughout the semester. Includes annotated bib, essay, proposal, and presentation. Lots of in class writing and peer review, but she made it fun. Highly recommend!

She's super kind and you can tell she loves to teach. She can be a bit repetitive, but she's clear on what she wants and provides a lot of resources to help you. Quizzes are every week but they're really easy - questions are sometimes literally word for word from the textbook.
You don't really need to buy the most up to date version of the textbook, It is a waste of money really. Just take good notes and utilize the writing center if you need additional assistance.

Very kind professor. You have one topic of choice for a semester-wide essay project. Gives us a required book to read but we only picked it up a couple of times. Grades very leniently. She grades 10% as participation so if you want an A in the class I recommend attending. She graded my essay nicely even though I feel like it wasn't good. TAKE HER!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Professor Smith is a great English Professor. We read a book for about a month and didn't read it again. There are weekly quizzes but once we get into the essay they are not every week. She really wants you do to well on the research paper and does class writings to help you get started. Only one essay 1200-1500 words.

The papers were easy and well-outlined. The lectures themselves felt like pulling teeth and made me crave anesthetics to ease the pain. Lectures felt boring and unnecessary. Easy class, but extremely boring if you already have a decent grasp on the material going in and are able to write a half-way-decent paper. Professor Smith is great though.

Professor Smith is the best! Only one essay, a semester long research project which is not as intimidating as it sounds! She provides clear expectations and deadlines and explains the assignments in great detail. She offers office hours and conferences and will let students know in advance about class cancellations. She is very caring!

In class she was engaging, though she usually took a more hands-off approach. Great if you're independent. However, it was to reach her outside of class. I asked her for a small deadline extension at the end of class, and she said "email me", so I did. She didn't respond until after the extended deadline I requested. Stuff like this happened a lot.

Professor Smith is one of the kindest professors I have ever met. She also does her best to make the class as entertaining and engaging as possible. Most of the work in the class consists of writing assignments, discussion posts, and reading quizzes which are all easy as long as you follow instructions and pay attention. Take her!!!

Very sweet and helpful for feedback. A lot of reading and quizzes on readings at the beginning of the semester but eventually dies down when the writing starts. Assignments really all lead into each other. Assignments are easy A's if you actually take the time to do them and ask for her feedback.

Smith was a very good professor for this class. All of the assignments were writing, but they were spaced out far enough that we had plenty of time to get everything done. She is a generous grader and is very understanding. I didn't find the class lectures super interesting, but I took it in the evening so we were all pretty tired. I recommend her!

Mrs. Smith is a wonderful English teacher. English is probably my least favorite subject, but she makes the class feel engaging and she wants you to earn a good grade. She gives great feedback on the discussion posts and gives feedback to almost every grade. I recommend her for any English class.

I would recommend Professor Smith. She was an amazing teacher/professor. Our class was hybrid. Even going to class once a week she still made sure that we knew what we should be doing in and outside of class. She was also very clear about what she expected of us. She was understanding and gave us more time on an essay if we needed it.

Mrs. Smith was an amazing teacher! I took the hybrid class and was very happy with the work load per week. We did lots of reading responses and turned in draft completions that help cushion your grade if you dont do so well on an essay. 10?10 would recommend her for everyone!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Truly a GEM!! She cares about more than academics and papers. Professor Smith kept us engaged the entire semester. Class is very light on work, so be sure to stay on top of your assignments. TAKE THIS CLASS!

Professor Smith was okay. She isn't a tough grader but her assignments directions are multi-step so make sure you read and provide what's required for the grade you want. Her lectures aren't boring, very chill but informative. She's big on feedback so submit drafts to papers on time. Would recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Prof. Smith is a very sweet professor that cares about her students' success. The class was not that hard but you want to put some effort in to get a good grade. Her essays are fairly simple and breaks them down in parts which makes them very easy in the long run. pay attention to her essay guidelines and you will do well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is nice and her class are fairly easy. Its a writing class so there are a few papers but none are too long. The whole semester you are basically writing one paper and turn in parts of it as you go along. There is a presentation over what you topic is but even that wasn't difficult.

Prof. Smith cares about the best interest of the student and she wants you to succeed. You will have to do weekly/biweekly discussion posts based on the required books. Heed all of the essay outlines that she has put on D2L and you should be good.  Points are taken off of your grade for missed days of class, though.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Great professor. She really cares about you and wants you to make a good grade. Easy grader and she proof reads every essay and gives you a lot of feedback. Easy A I promise you want to take her.
Awesome professor. She is very clear on what she expects in your essays and proof reads them every time before you turn it in. Take her
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria
